data.4512237707958267230: In NightWatch, the settings button now opens the user list. There is also now an owl menu in editing mode so you can switch the language.
data.520064286630425505: The evaluation of the treatment data has been refined, so that SMB data can be recognized more flexibly. Something has probably changed in AAPS that has not yet been taken into account in Nightscout Reporter.
data.4738751511378216379: The display on mobile phones with the current Android version has been corrected so that the lower bar with the owl menu and the run button should always be visible.
data.513832064733384268: In the list of users, users can now be given a star. These starred users are sorted to the top. In a list with many users, you can use this method to quickly find the ones you are currently dealing with.
data.7903838095906092931: If there are copied forms in a shortcut definition, these are now also output when the PDF is created via the call with the URL parameters.
data.4223083466617162706: The profile basal rate in the daily graph should now be displayed correctly again.
data.7892622953137029309: The setting for the maximum glucose value in graphs works as intended again.
data.6104897900996596813: Po načtení dat se data zkontrolují, zda existují nějaké datové soubory, které byly nahrány z různých zařízení. Pokud tomu tak je, zobrazí se dialogové okno, ve kterém musí být zvoleno požadované zařízení pro hodnocení. Existuje také možnost „Vše“, s níž jsou hodnoty zobrazeny společně jako předtím. Pokud je tento výběr proveden, bude v pravém horním rohu každé stránky zobrazeno varování, které upozorní na tuto skutečnost.
data.7148032414959418926: A new shortcut parameter has been added that makes it possible to specify a device for which the analysis should take place. If none is specified, the selection "All" is made automatically. The Url with all parameters looks like this:
data.5332746139353515370: the name that was entered as a description for the shortcut.
data.1987277142193456291: the name of the user for whom the PDF is to be created. If this parameter is not given, the last opened user is used.
data.8833829938648090830: the number of months that the saved period is shifted to the past.
data.6670378250614653646: the name of the device for which the analysis should be done. If this parameter is given and no entry contains this text, then all entries are used. The same applies if this parameter is not available.
data.2417089166472173813: Všechny parametry rozlišují velká a malá písmena.
data.1324449941873906044: If the notes are entered in Hebrew, they are now also displayed correctly. There is the problem with multi-line comments that the order of the lines is reversed, which can be corrected by commas in the text. So instead of: {$LINE_BREAK}{$LINE_BREAK} זהו טקסט נפלא עם יותר מדי מילים {$LINE_BREAK}{$LINE_BREAK} it should be written like this: {$LINE_BREAK}{$LINE_BREAK} זה טקסט נפלא, עם יותר מדי מילים {$LINE_BREAK}{$LINE_BREAK} This then ensures that two lines appear in the correct order in the PDF. Nightscout Reporter does not yet have general support for fonts written from right to left. Since no one has so far shown up who would like something like this and would do the translation of the texts in Nightscout Reporter, this special solution for Hebrew notes will currently be the only one.
data.4752503161171459512: The start with shortcuts and Night Watch has been slightly modified. Instead of a # character, the call is now executed using the corresponding specification in the path. So instead of {$LINE_BREAK}{$LINE_BREAK}{$INTERPOLATION}#watch {$LINE_BREAK}{$LINE_BREAK} the following is used: {$LINE_BREAK}{$LINE_BREAK}{$INTERPOLATION}/watch {$LINE_BREAK}{$LINE_BREAK} With that, the use as installed apps is more stable on Windows and smartphones when you refresh the pages.
data.906220988767368582: Fixed Night Watch display to gray out for values that are too far in the past. So you can see at a glance whether the value should be used to look at the current blood sugar level or not. In this case, "too far in the past" means longer than 14 minutes.
data.94711824034349494: Since Czech was added as a new language (many thanks to Lukáš Trčka, who takes care of the translation), the language menu, which can be reached via the owl at the bottom left, has been redesigned with multiple columns.
data.8483841813240634416: The link to the facebook page has been removed from the menu because the facebook page is only for general information about a new version and you won't find any information there that isn't available in the program. In addition, the developer is unable to configure the Facebook apps to send him notifications that he has been contacted. Maybe Facebook is so bad in general that it's not possible without being bombarded with unimportant notifications. Because of this, in the past some users had to wait quite a long time for a message. Therefore the following has been added:
data.4137795264534617440: In the main menu the menuitem {$START_BOLD_TEXT}Feedback{$CLOSE_BOLD_TEXT} was added. This starts the program set for emails in the system and prepares an email to be sent to the developer. The mail can then be edited as desired to describe what needs to be known by the developer. The URL to the Nightscout instance is also copied to the mail, since this information is very useful in most cases to be able to reproduce the problem. However, this URL can also be deleted from the email before it is sent if it is not relevant for the reproducibility of the problem.
data.535461402240582918: The call with a shortcut parameter could use an incorrect period. That has been fixed. The saved period is now evaluated correctly even when the PDFs are created automatically.
data.8071144112919035611: From this version there is again the possibility to synchronize the Nightscout Reporter settings so that you no longer have to enter them again in other browsers or on other devices. The synchronization currently only works via Dropbox. If you have an account there, you can connect to it. This is done in the main menu on the left side with the "Synchronize" item. When this is called, the Dropbox authentication workflow is started after a prompt. If this was successfully completed, the settings are searched for there when loading and saved there when saving. It is saved in the Apps/Nightscout Reporter directory. Nightscout Reporter only needs permission to write and read files in this directory. If you no longer want to be connected to Dropbox, you simply have to click on the menu item in the main menu again.
data.6819744304217825375: It is now possible to directly generate a PDF based on the settings in a shortcut by specifying this shortcut in the Url. The Url must be structured as follows:
data.4655103433942523651: Here x is the name that was entered as a label for the shortcut.
data.2390492678551989865: Specifying user is optional. u is the name of the user for whom the PDF is to be created. If this parameter is not given, the last opened user is used.
data.8618058262483440893: Specifying shift is also optional. s is the number of months that the saved period is shifted to the past.
data.2738398918880268905: The icon that opens the menu now shows the logo of the service used for synchronization when synchronization is active. If it's not active, you'll see the normal hamburger menu icon there.
data.5582673188994485243: The owl menu at the bottom left is now also available in the user list.
data.482248695755586259: If the URL validation fails when saving a user, a dialog is now displayed showing the reason for the failed save and giving the option to save anyway. In addition, an attempt is made to use the URL to determine which service is used for the Nightscout instance. If it is a known service (currently ns.10be.de and Google Cloud), a button is created in the footer of the dialog that calls up further information or the service itself.
data.3602562000873892311: The progress bar for loading the data now also indicates when the output is for historical data.
data.1885980635469549019: The user list is now sorted alphabetically without case sensitivity.
data.9147583850026575603: If the profile table has been overloaded with too many entries by the uploader, it can happen that Nightscout Reporter cannot generate a report because this flood of data makes any meaningful evaluation impossible. That's why there is an option in the settings for some time to reduce the number of profile data sets when loading. This reduction is now done automatically when Nightscout Reporter realizes that it isn't getting any records or loading takes too long. The setting is retained for the time being, however, so that you can have some influence on the result if you want to. This does not solve the fundamental problem of uploaders running amok (e.g. Loop on iOS), but at least it now allows reports to be generated when the amount of data becomes critical.
data.3695402035274078275: The selection of the user has been changed. Previously, a list opened in which the users could be seen when you clicked on the user name in the title bar. Instead of the list, the content area is now used to display the users with tiles. The current user is marked like a selected form. The current user can be deleted with the trash can icon on the left and you can open the settings with the gear icon on the right. As before, any number of users can be created. When the list of users gets too big for the screen, it becomes scrollable. If the current user is clicked, it switches back to the list of forms.
data.7994419806233540093: Everything is new. This isn't clearly visible on the surface, but Nightscout Reporter's programming language was changed from Dart to Angular, which required a complete program rewrite. The functionality remained the same, it will just be much easier to keep up with the development of technology in the future.
data.1166758568411188349: All dialogs can now be moved by dragging the title bar.
data.6721276048066176732: The button for creating the PDFs now shows how many forms are selected.
data.1462334184601077398: The button for selecting the period will indicate if it is not until today but until yesterday or the previous weekend.
data.1260833994115896398: There is now a checkbox in the form parameters to switch all options on or off at once.
data.4030589048117050056: Night-Watch now also has displays for changes of catheter, reservoir, sensor and battery. Next to the corresponding symbol is displayed how long ago the corresponding change was made.
data.7209177190740720365: Hovering the mouse over a language in the language menu shows how far Nightscout Reporter has been translated into the respective language. Clicking on this progress bar will open the Crowdin page where you can translate the language if you have a Crowdin account. Everyone is free to do the translations there. The translations will then be visible in the next version in Nightscout Reporter. However, they are also updated from time to time between versions.
data.4893065009443255132: In the output parameters it is now possible to specify that the values are ignored for a certain time after a sensor change. This means that the values, which fluctuate greatly with many sensors in the initial period after a sensor change, can be removed from the reports.
data.8816201866526892204: The PDFs are now generated entirely in the user's browser. It is no longer necessary for the data created to be processed by the server. This means that significantly larger PDF files can be generated. This was attempted with 6 months of data resulting in a PDF with 3300 pages.
data.8105894564413047583: The input of the period for the PDFs has been moved from the title bar of the application to the dialog for the output parameters.
data.2147877801689349234: Language switching has been moved from the dropdown menu on the left to the owl menu in the bottom left corner. If you click on that, you can select the color theme as usual and the available languages will appear in the form of the corresponding national flag.
data.455172185366005575: The menu on the left does not close with every action. This was necessary with the old way of building the application, but there are other options in the new world. So you can click different options without having to open the menu every time.
data.1249244568808099334: The display of the current value in the title bar has been removed, since there is now Night-Watch, which can display this much better.
data.2851440788059309778: The ability to split the generated PDF into smaller portions has been removed as it no longer seems necessary with the current technology.
data.8814171678911880391: Fixed many issues with the appearance of certain areas of the application.
data.852241593925968958: In Night-Watch there is now the possibility to enter the settings if you have activated the editor.
data.7690963465911786727: In Night-Watch you can now activate a night mode in which the background is black and the colours of the text represent the current value in relation to the target area.
data.1555329174638511589: The setting for adjusting BG_TARGET_BOTTOM and BG_TARGET_TOP is now independent of the "Adjust Glucose Values" selection. This allows you to toggle the option without having to reconfigure the target area on the server.
data.2070423548703697974: Night-Watch now also displays values if they have been saved multiple times in Nightscout by multiple uploaders within a short period of time. This should be avoided if possible, but now Night-Watch can also deal with it.
data.1791903212401138744: A new view called {$START_ITALIC_TEXT}Night-Watch{$CLOSE_ITALIC_TEXT} has been added. In this view, as in the clock display on the Nightscout page, you can see the current glucose value and other information that you can configure to a certain extent as you like it. Night-Watch is accessed via this URL: {$START_LINK} https://nightrep.zreptil.de/watch {$CLOSE_LINK} It can also be accessed via the main menu under the menu item {$START_ITALIC_TEXT}Night-Watch{$CLOSE_ITALIC_TEXT}, or by clicking on the current sugar value in Nightscout Reporter's title bar if you have activated it in the settings.
data.5736239371712783896: The configuration is done directly in the Night-Watch window by clicking on something. This sets the page to edit mode and the existing elements can be changed, moved, deleted or new elements can be added using the controls at the bottom of the window. With the save icon in the controls, the settings are saved and the edit mode is closed. It can also be closed by clicking the active item, but the changes will not be saved. After reloading the page you see the last view.
data.1050317483122628114: If Night-Watch is called without any configuration available, you can edit your settings via the well-known settings window. This happens when you install the page as a web app, since the browser memory, in which the configuration is stored, has usually not yet been filled.
data.5947493486939609850: Where a CGP can be created, there is now an option {$START_ITALIC_TEXT}Lines around areas{$CLOSE_ITALIC_TEXT}. This is switched on by default. When turned off, the healthy and current human stat ranges are no longer outlined with a line. This makes the graph look a little more pale, but you can examine the values on the axes more closely if you wish.
data.8360132556674484241: The adjustment of the glucose values is now saved in the settings. However, it can still be changed in the output parameters in order to be able to create a comparison without any detours.
data.3002649473456271492: The display of the factor on the PDF when a correction factor has been set has been changed to a percentage by which the sugar values have been increased or decreased.
data.5161800057808633917: The last version had changes in the code that weren't really thought through. I apologize for that. I removed these so that Nightscout Reporter offers the usual functionality again for all users.
data.2790002888153650104: The glucose values can now be corrected with a factor that results from the A1C value determined by the laboratory and calculated in the program. This factor affects all sensor values processed in Nightscout Reporter. The factor is specified in the output parameters. There it is activated and deactivated via the "Adjust glucose values" checkbox. When activated, two sliders appear. The upper one defines the calculated A1C, the lower one the A1C determined by the laboratory. If it is activated, the factor with which the glucose values were corrected is indicated on the top right of each PDF. This affects every PDF on which glucose values are processed.
data.1769909291323572792: The mean glucose value in healthy people in the CGM has been adjusted to the correct value of 90 mg/dl.
data.1532752124480011601: If the data for the daily steps taken is available in Nightscout, then these are displayed in the daily graph if the "Show Exercises" option is activated there.
data.1870892084810980626: In the options for the daily graphic there is now the option to set the upper value for the carbohydrates. This can improve the scaling with high COB values.
data.5806530923856567958: AAPS 3.0 will change some of the data structures and amounts of data that are stored. This causes problems in some places in Nightscout Reporter that cannot be generally solved. That is why there is now the option "Correction for data changes in AAPS 3.0" in the output parameters, with which certain problems can be corrected when creating the PDFs. These changes are marked here with FixAAPS30.
data.8393381918629325198: FixAAPS30: The creation of the PDFs can take an extremely long time. This is due to a flood of profile switches that are created by a plug-in for automation. This causes a profile switch every 4 minutes with storage of the complete profile. If the option is active, then these profile switches are sorted out and thus enable the creation of the PDF. These profile switches are then no longer visible in the PDFs.
data.2751104959635245741: It is now possible to duplicate forms in the tile view in order to create different views of the same form at once. There is a copy icon on the bottom right of the tiles. When this is triggered, the current form is copied and inserted as a new tile behind the current tile. This can then be treated in the same way as any other tile. There is a trash can icon at the bottom right of this new tile. When this is triggered, the tile is removed. A maximum of 2 copies can be made of a form. The options for the forms, as well as the order, are saved as before. The copied tiles are therefore retained. The copied forms also appear in the list view. However, there is no possibility of copying or deleting them there. This must be done in the tile view.
data.6745578137559489120: In the profile and basal rate forms there is a new option "Use profile 'NR profile'". Normally, the profile to be used is determined automatically based on the specified time period. This option can be used to prevent this behavior and a profile with the name "NR Profil" is searched for. If this is found, it will be displayed. If it is not found, a text is shown that explains where this can be set.
data.8872022155836002913: The table in the glucose percentile diagram can now display two new columns. These include the average carbohydrates and units of insulin.
data.1288949110572989112: In the options of forms in which you can show and hide columns, it is now shown how many columns are still available.
data.2129586481684638035: The colors for the glucose areas are now displayed lighter where they are used as a background color with text to make them easier to read.
data.3126436268119900262: The temporary overrides of iLoop can now also be displayed in the daily graphics. The text of the reason is displayed. As before, this can also be displayed in the log for more detailed information.
data.3641087201992938885: The project was updated to Dart 2.13.4 and Angular 6.0.1.
data.6108433000631385298: Limit values were not consistently treated in the same way. The assignment of the values to the target areas should now be identical in the entire program.
data.7775437439433173719: There is a new form called "Distribution of glucose values". This shows the percentage distribution of the glucose values for the selected period.
data.6226802260373705016: In the daily statistics, the average values for some values are now also displayed in the totals line.
data.8564681797670707729: When defining the period, you can now specify up to which day the period should be determined. As before, the current day is preset. You can also set yesterday to have days with complete dates, or the last weekend if you are interested in complete weeks.
data.367303512291797081: Dialogs and the display of the progress are now implemented a little different technically. Because of this, the application background is now shown darker in the cases and it is not possible to click on anything.
data.7340603650425734708: Fixed a bug that caused dialogs to be closed with Escape, leaving the application in an unusable state.
data.5905727688073027582: A bug has been fixed that prevented usage of the app when selecting the time period if you focused on an empty input field.
data.6190617408362038063: A bug has been fixed that caused the application to be in an undefined state when the last user was deleted.
data.5363903869059504921: The incorrect name for average carbohydrates per day in the daily statistics has been replaced by the correct name for average carbohydrates per meal.
data.8334086213032649583: The output of the target value and the blood values in the daily graphic has been corrected. There were problems when a different blood sugar unit than the one set on the server was used for output.
data.5719790065377190370: After I was asked again and again whether I could be donated, I decided to make such a possibility available. Nightscout Reporter is still completely free and will stay that way. If you still want to express your affection for the program, I don't want to stand in your way any longer. The donation button is not visible. But if you want to throw something in the {$START_BOLD_TEXT}hat{$CLOSE_BOLD_TEXT}, you will find it :)
data.8107955527265901582: The Nightscout Reporter logo has been changed. It is still the well-known and popular owl, but it now wears a hat like the newspaper deliverers and sometimes also journalists in ancient films. The logo is only shown in the program and does not appear on the PDFs. There is still the normal Nightscout logo because it was placed there to refer to Nightscout itself.
data.3486776005303008081: An error in the output of the temporary goals in the daily graphic has been fixed.
data.249203943265379320: Columns for TDD and carbohydrates can now be displayed in the daily statistics.
data.9077822308483882893: The URLs of the users are now sorted according to the end date.
data.1648006290762345134: The title of the Glucose Percentile Diagram is no longer displayed incorrectly in the form selection options when printing in portrait format.
data.4662473426829266826: There is a new option in the daily graph with which you can show and hide the target value.
data.3973581189074376000: An error has been corrected which resulted in missing data such as treatments no longer being able to create a PDF.
data.4189163313360250386: In the output parameters there is a checkbox with which you can ensure that all options that would indicate a loop are deactivated for this output. These are the options that are marked with a circle (= loop).
data.1385194978895103036: When Nightscout Reporter was started for the first time, it was displayed normally when the language changed. Now it stays on the welcome dialog as intended.
data.2015943630007503660: The display of the images on tiles is now correctly preset in the settings as intended.
data.2368803697644471999: There are now small help buttons on the forms. In the list view they replace the icons for dragging the forms, in the tile view they are displayed on the top left of the tiles. The respective view can be selected in the hamburger menu. When you click on such a button, a text is displayed that describes what the corresponding form shows.
data.4801150433240118911: In the output parameters, you can now specify the unit in which the glucose values are to be shown. At the beginning this is determined from the data stored in Nightscout and pre-assigned accordingly. But it is also possible to change this unit or to have both units shown. If "both" is selected, then every form on which glucose information is available is shown first with mg/dL and then again with mmol/l. This unit is also saved in the shortcuts.
data.5363146551438448686: The profile basal rate in the daily profile form is now also displayed with bars.
data.8986914645891772545: iOS Loop misuses the profile table to save its own settings, which for users of this software meant that the profile table could not be loaded correctly. Therefore, in the settings there is now the option of restricting the number of data records that are loaded from the profile table.
data.7546949084135718483: Temporary overrides which are entered in the treatment data by iOSLoop are now also shown in the daily log.
data.551024001500537626: In the daily profile you can now specify whether only the value, the percentage adjustment of the profile or both should be displayed. In addition, a line can be inserted that shows the value set in the basal profile at the respective point in time.
data.776628642357054674: Profile changes are no longer displayed in the daily graphic if the profile has not changed. iOSLoop very often inserts new profiles into the nightscout data records that do not contain any changes because other configuration settings are also saved there.
data.6403133731909788820: An error when loading the selected forms has been fixed.
data.2058680923660828079: When syncing with Google Drive is canceled, the authorization is now reset properly. If you want to synchronize again afterwards, the authorizations are requested again.
data.3088655788723001856: A bug has been fixed that caused temporary targets to be displayed in the daily graph with a time shift.
data.254350099574435930: Insulin deliveries are now also displayed on the Protocol page, e.g. if they were entered via xdrip.
data.6668542709116248568: There are now shortcuts with which you can save the current selection of forms, their parameters and the selected period. When activating a shortcut, everything is set back to what it was when the shortcut was saved.
data.1212576341097901577: With herokuapp and other providers of free database instances, the instance's storage space is limited, which is why it becomes full at some point. Then you can create a new instance, but Nightscout Reporter needs access to all instances for which you want to receive a PDF in order to be able to display it seamlessly every day. Therefore, multiple URLs can now be entered for the Nightscout instances. In addition, you have to enter which is the first and the last day with data. With this information, Nightscout Reporter can then seamlessly evaluate the required data across multiple instances.
data.5995258864673211674: If a value in the CGP exceeds the maximum value of the scale, the corresponding corner is marked with a yellow circle.
data.4859852917369166314: In addition to the URL input fields, there is a button on the Settings dialog to open the URL in a new browser window.
data.3447517096322897919: The entry of the access key in the settings dialog can now be made readable with a button next to the input field.
data.1711733399034110313: In the Settings dialog there is now the possibility to export and import the settings. When exporting, a file is written with the general settings; when importing, such a file is read in again. This allows you to manually synchronize the settings across different browsers even without Google Drive access.
data.8856258134513163384: In the daily log there is now the possibility to have duplicate records marked. Nightscout Reporter filters them out, but it can show how often a particular record was found in the data. You can also specify that it should only output data records that exist more than once. This way you can find out possible differences between Nightscout Reporter and other reporting tools.
data.9205635258616208737: The CGP is now generated correctly even with extreme values.
data.6153436125529965415: The scale labels have been corrected in the CGP.
data.1943421202531989250: In the dialog of the output parameters there is now the possibility to always generate the CGP with the standard target area. This option is initially activated because the CGP is a standardized form that is often used for comparison purposes. But you can turn it off for your own purposes. This setting is retained.
data.4323473302664976561: The last profile change was sometimes ignored when determining the profile. That is now fixed.
data.2472629482396530303: In the dialog of the Output Parameters, the switch "for comparison purposes" was added in the top right. If this is activated, the standard target area is used everywhere. Internally, this is also used for other adjustments. This option is designed so that you can compare your printouts with other diabetics. This is useful, for example, for submission to doctors and diabetes consultants.
data.178167591864512183: You can now specify in the output parameters whether the newest day is always displayed first. This has an impact on the daily graph, the daily statistics and the weekly graph. The corresponding option has been removed from the form options.
data.4069609562496327381: The setting for opening the PDF in the same window, downloading the PDF and hiding text about Nightscout in the PDF has been moved from the settings to the output parameters. This allows you to quickly set and change that for each output.
data.1889463294004142043: The title above the table of glucose percentile diagram has been corrected.
data.1859396878177985943: The legend of the daily graphic now includes the entry for blood values.
data.6952979771734977277: The microboli from the Minimed 600 Uploader have been removed from the output, because they are just temporary basal rates.
data.646288099630857269: A possible crash in the output of the CGP in the daily graphic has been fixed.
data.1457203540861930912: In the dialog with the output parameters, an option was added to specify the precision of the output of basal information. This is usually determined from the information on the basal rate in the profiles. This is still the case when the first entry in the list is selected. Otherwise, all basal information is output with the precision selected for this option.
data.8264241065914297074: The precision of ISF in profile was corrected.
data.3527586935053740660: In the log, the information that sets a temporary target of 0 U for 0 minutes is output as "Cancel temp target".
data.1244966041592586421: Various calculations were corrected in the CGP, which were mainly shown in differences in ToR and average values.
data.5927508921047157494: The legend of the daily graphic has been expanded to include the entry for exercises.
data.8235016752586028422: In the daily graphic in the german version "Training" was replaced by "Bewegung" since this matches the wording in AAPS better.
data.8561248196119572242: The color for exercises in the daily graphic changed.
data.2821808669677263348: The analysis values were not determined correctly. This has been corrected and the statistical data evaluated over the period should now be correct.
data.5860943879159140968: When the treatment data is loaded, duplicate data records are filtered out.
data.5144857777940134247: The calculated IE for carbohydrates in the daily graph were partly determined with wrong factors. The bug has been fixed.
data.578951855176091443: In the percentile diagram there is a new option with which the basalrate can be displayed below the diagram. Since the diagram normally spans a longer period, the basalrate that was active at the beginning of the period is displayed.
data.5043358342819391308: Fixed a bug that sometimes prevented the parameters for the tiles from being called in the tile view.
data.2520143539437399731: There is a new PDF called Daily Trend. This shows the values of a day together with the trend on the hour and the basal rate set in the profile. This is a good overview for basal rate tests to see where something needs to be adjusted.
data.2375241106938069440: There is a new option in the daily graph to prevent the rounding of the insulin values to the maximum precision in the profile. This makes sense when either there is no profile or when values are entered with greater precision than in the profile.
data.6702430398101655097: In the daily graph you can now display the IOB (Insulin On Board) and COB (Carbs On Board). The IOB is shown at the top, where the bolus is shown, the COB at the bottom, where the carbohydrates are shown.
data.1651519445898465212: Nightscout Reporter can now also be used in Portuguese.
data.1008274726311390907: There is a new PDF called Dayhours. This shows the average values of a day in every hourly interval and fills the cells backgroundcolor according to the glucose value. This gives you a good overview of the distribution of values in the selected period.
data.7104630496375913610: In the Glucose Percentile Diagram you can now set a maximum for the scaling. If it is set to "Automatic", the maximum is determined as before. For any other value, the upper limit for the diagram is set to this value. This makes it easier to compare two diagrams with different upper limits.
data.8375454931910189110: Before a PDF is created, a dialog is displayed in which you can enter parameters for all PDFs created. You can set the target area to the standard area that doctors like to see. This has an impact on all representations of the target area, as well as on the distribution of the values inside and outside the target area. You can also set the maximum value for glucose in graphics there. This value is used in the daily graphics, the percentile diagram and the weekly graphics. If it is set to "Automatic", the maximum value is determined from the existing data as before. You can also specify here whether you want to generate the current period or a comparison period. This is useful to show the doctor a comparison of past and now values.
data.5288956970564382460: The buttons for creating previous periods have been removed. This can now be set in the new PDF dialog.
data.6173496910859711125: If there are empty columns on the profile page, this no longer leads to an empty page.
data.219984260763911802: The values VarK and ToR in the CGP are correctly output for day and week graphics in the legend and in the graphic.
data.1809235701722508795: The images on the tiles are now labeled in the respective language.
data.4397306327955789552: The values in the CGP are now also correctly displayed for mmol data.
data.4560018245994990811: The glycemic variability is now correctly displayed in the CGP even with daily and weekly graphics.
data.4654989694327732254: Blood values should now also be displayed correctly in the daily graph for mmol data.
data.2302435151120933638: There is a new option on the page "Hourly Statistics" to also show columns with 10% and 90%.
data.4183107641349593655: The validity is now displayed with the time on the "Profile" page.
data.2351955831263495533: The entries in the log for temporary targets are now displayed correctly even with mmol data.
data.4371971384726011702: The heading above the middle column in the daily profile has been corrected.
data.344285122296548980: The bars in the analysis are now scaled correctly.
data.7529089406957892656: Most of the columns on the page "Hourly Statistics" are left blank if there is no data.
data.4338020822976744494: In the daily graphics, there is the option to suppress HTML notes. Some uploaders write complete HTML pages in the notes, which is extremely difficult to render in the PDF. That's why you can hide them by setting this option.
data.1486315394846247998: The Glucose Percentile Graph has been expanded to include the Hourly Statistics table. This tabulates the values of the period for each hour of the day. You can either create just the graphic, just the table or both together.
data.4296089440581191975: Slovak is now also available In the language selection.
data.5917099675353120492: There is a new PDF page for the daily profiles. It contains a table showing the actual basal rate for the day, including all temporary adjustments. I needed that for debugging, but maybe the some users find it interesting too. The profile displayed there corresponds to the day profile on the page Daily Graphics. Loops can produce many pages, as the basalrate is usually adjusted every few minutes. Therefore, depending on the amount of data, the table is displayed in a maximum of three columns to reduce the number of pages.
data.1157175530873408256: Delayed boli are now displayed in the daily graph.
data.5992158705594270344: The daily graph now shows the duration of the basal rate at 0%.
data.5608198084809920921: The UI can now assume different representations. These show themselves at the moment by different colours and an adapted icon in the Browser tab and with the loading of the side. This does not affect the generated PDF files. It's the preparation for a partially customizable surface. The theme of the UI is set by default by the system, which currently means that a Christmas theme will be displayed in December. But this can be changed by clicking on the icon, which can be seen at the bottom left. When clicking the icon, an area with the available themes is displayed to the right of the icon. The first icon (the little wizard) means that the theme is determined by the system. At the moment this means the Christmas presentation in December. However, there may be other criteria in the future that will be used to adjust the theme. However, the direct definition of a theme with one of the other icons always takes precedence over the system logic.
data.3888140531601603940: With the basalrate and the profile, there is now an option to have only the last one printed in the corresponding period. This reduces the number of pages with frequent profile changes.
data.2024681007626528818: In the analysis, an area can now be displayed, showing the number of hypos in the selected period and the time of the last hypo.
data.1035689884230136345: In the settings dialog, the lines with the user details and the URL were exchanged for a more meaningful administration.
data.1641271819822982368: The page numbers on the tiles have been moved further to the bottom so they are always easy to read.
data.344506395878755771: The profiles for the period were partially incorrectly identified. That should be fixed.
data.2030029299779748010: The determination of the effective daily basal rate has been restructured and should now give more accurate values.
data.4325695290778507968: The error with the multiplication of the carbohydrates with the repeated output of the PDFs was corrected.
data.1569989707425310522: The problem that certain days could not be created has been fixed.
data.3638886361385276435: An error in number formatting has been fixed.
data.2065332686732298551: The temporary basal rate at the beginning of the day has been set incorrectly if it was set in the previous day. This has been fixed.
data.949068715944509998: The protocol can now also show battery changes of the pump.
data.458883639069462613: The single page CGP can now also be output in landscape format.
data.228516987941010013: The accumulation of the values in the analysis has been corrected.
data.1374861392086238047: In the tile view, the parameters of all selected pages can be set together in a list. For this purpose, there is an additional button in the title area of the parameter list next to the close button, with which you can switch between the two options.
data.6987738548003965177: The settings for downloading the PDF, opening the PDF in the same window, and the maximum size of the PDFs were excluded from syncing with Google Drive because they are specific to the browser or device you are using. They are still saved, but they are not synchronized between different browsers.
data.3323452754604557042: The preview images on the tiles will partially adjust depending on the options selected (for example, choosing CGP for day graphics).
data.637973906878144864: The CGP now displays the current values in the legend.
data.8324624518437788500: It is now possible to save the settings to Google Drive. This has the advantage that you have the settings not only in the current browser, but in any browser, which is connected to your Google account. The settings are still stored in the browser. When connected to Google Drive, they will also be stored on Google Drive. When loading the page, it checks if synchronization is desired. If that's the case then the data will be downloaded from Google Drive. If the downloaded data is newer than the data in the browser, it will be used. Once the data is saved, syncing will save that data with the current timestamp to Google Drive. The synchronization is activated and deactivated in the menu on the left side. It can also be activated when calling the page fpr the first time in a new browser directly in the welcome screen. Nightscout Reporter only requires permission to save and load your own app data and does not require access to other data on Google Drive.
data.1537316464073239080: When selecting the daily basal rate, it is now possible to specify in the options of the daily graph that the name of the profile that was active at the beginning of the day is displayed. This will then be displayed as a profile change at 0 am.
data.4133750409032285515: Images can now be displayed on tiles instead of names. The pictures then show the approximate appearance of the corresponding page. They do not correspond to the actual data, but are just a visual representation that may make it easier for some users to quickly select the pages they want. The activation of the images can be done using the settings dialog.
data.6779869517946618634: Fixed wrong data display in the daily statistics when a day has too little data.
data.4206805838472246561: On the profile and basal rate pages, the title bar now again shows the date where this profile starts.
data.3643845729189557867: Temporary profile changes are now recognized and displayed correctly in the daily graphics.
data.8146468687629465400: The "Comprehensive Glucose Pentagon" has been added as a separate PDF and as an additional page to the daily and weekly chart. It is a representation of five measures, with the help of which the quality of the therapy can be determined and compared with others. On the printouts, a reference is output to the underlying paper.
data.5473742690313153149: In the daily graph, there is an option to display the calculated IE for ingested carbohydrates. The value displayed below the carbs is the bolus that should be delivered for that amount of carbohydrate at that time. This value may be lower than the actual value delivered, because IOB and other factors are taken into account for insulin delivery.
data.8975705877195107130: In the daily graph, the temporary targets are now also taken into account when displaying the target value.
data.7961594264824963560: There is a new option in the analysis to fine-tune the standard range. Very high values and very low values are displayed with this option.
data.1214528572829489975: Nightscout Reporter can now be used in Japanese.
data.6500412548922445683: It is now possible to display the buttons for PDF selection as tiles. The option can be found in the menu on the left. In the tile view, the buttons are distributed over the available area and are thus easier to hit on small devices. In addition, you normally see all available PDFs at a glance and do not have to scroll. The activated tiles indicate at which point in the PDF the corresponding pages are created and how many pages the corresponding tile creates. The number of pages can be determined correctly for most tiles, but for some this is not possible without data insight (for example, profiles and protocol). In this case, either no page number or a minimum number of pages is shown. Once the PDF is created, the correct numbers will be displayed. The sortorder of the tiles can be changed by dragging it to where you want it. After clicking the icon in the upper right corner, the parameters for the corresponding PDF can be set.
data.7160940962425267941: The profile now shows the total basal rate and the average ICR and ISF per hour.
data.4695217704774528427: Options for the PDFs that have a unique relationship to a running loop are now displayed in blue. This makes it easy to create PDFs where you can not easily deduce that there is a loop running. All you have to do is to uncheck the blue options.
data.1014059318041581677: The basalrate profiles for the day are now also determined based on the treatment data. Profile changes are displayed in the daily graph and should also show a correct basal rate adjustment from the moment of change.
data.7942425111070005991: The pages profile and basalrate for a profile that was temporarily active during one day now only show this timespan.
data.9184436701168902285: The Buttons for past periods will not be displayed if no period or PDF is selected.
data.4268264579661177316: Some of the options for the PDFs have been arranged hierarchically. There is no point in having the SMB values placed in the daily graph at the curve if the SMB values are not displayed at all. Therefore, options that depend on another option are only displayed if the corresponding option is selected. This unfortunately also changes the storage of options, which is why the current selection of options for some PDFs changed. These options have to be set again.
data.2157030766827342548: The selection of the period and the user has been moved to the title bar.
data.1815971569776610202: The determination of the unit (mg/dl or mmol/l) is now handled more flexibly, so that even spaces in the corresponding setting no longer lead to a misinterpretation.
data.5632679110845292760: A bug has been fixed that caused the daily graphics to overwrite texts in the legend.
data.712859232306955242: The calculation of the PDF sizes has been corrected, so that fewer PDFs are created when they are divided due to the size.
data.6857274831409329221: The same database is used to calculate the analysis, daily statistics and daily graphs so that the values are the same on all PDFs.
data.8409005361355205198: Blood values which are entered by Loop on the iPhone are now also recognized.
data.2654047377927903318: There is now the ability to generate PDFs of past periods without having to adjust the period. there are two buttons for earlier periods above the button for creating PDF which generate the PDFs. The lower of the two buttons generates the previous period, the upper one the penultimate period. The buttons show the start date and the end date. If the period "last 2 weeks" is selected, then the lower button creates the period from two weeks starting four weeks ago and the upper button the period from two weeks starting six weeks ago. In this way, it is easy to generate comparison reports to detect the development of the values. The words "Historical 1" or "Historical 2" are placed above the period on the pages for these printouts in the header. So you can distinguish the data from each other when comparing the sheets.
data.4254345544296939544: The partially misallocated limits for the areas (low, normal, high) have been corrected.
data.7593372333861890400: Increased the width of column for ICR on the profilepage.
data.8979739944203859295: If the basalrate has more than 2 decimals the insulin values are smaller on the daily graphics.
data.5979934076766905336: Removed the obsolete option for the decimals of the basalrate from the daily graphics.
data.1760128920365351301: A link to the Facebook page of Nightscout Reporter was added to the menu.
data.4401082481560828706: The mixture of two pages on one PDF page, which sometimes occurred has been fixed.
data.7283909761894961461: There is a new option in the settings to display the last glucose value stored in Nightscout in the title bar. If this option is enabled, the current value, the age of the value, the trend arrow and the difference to the previous value is displayed at the right side of the title bar. This display is updated every minute as long as your browser window has the input focus. If it hasn't the focus, the update is stopped and the value is hidden to avoid unnecessary burden on system resources.
data.6127082239864610996: In the daily graphis there is an option, that adds the exercise data to the graphic. It will be displayed at the bottom of the graphic right above the glucosetable.
data.4887685844134622096: The columns on the page have been corrected to accommodate longer time names (e.g. in Spanish).
data.6192414002366785723: In daily graphics and weekly graphics there is now the possibility to place 1, 2, 4, 8 or 16 images on a page.
data.5086156331613866941: The division into multiple PDF files works better now.
data.4861197973031231700: If the period is empty, the button for the selection is marked clearly and in the dialog to choose an indication appears in the title bar.
data.3355549227663925374: It is now possible to set the days of the week that should be used in the period. When selecting a period the corresponding days are set with the buttons below the month. On the PDFs, the periods are shown with the days of the week that are used, if at least one is missing.
data.8146993522866256440: The scales on the graphics have been updated. Now they show whole numbers for mmol/L and the units have been removed. These are shown at the bottom of the graphics. This includes the daily graphics, weekly graphics and the glucose percentile chart.
data.2704758718840952536: If the generated PDF is too large, it is divided on several PDF files now. In this case, it will not directly open, but there will be shown a list of numbered buttons. These buttons open the corresponding PDF and get a checkmark, indicating that it has been opened. This should make it easier to open the PDFs, because usually the current browserwindow is moved to the background when a new window is opened.
data.5827392287548842147: In the settings there is a slider that defines how large the resulting PDF files may be. When a blank PDF is created, then this slider should be moved further to the left, to reduce the file size.
data.2256302951336884805: The display of SMB can now be hidden in daily graphics.
data.7642863960408671309: The order of the forms can now be changed. Simply click on the handle on the left side of the button for the form, hold it and drag it to the place where it should be printed.
data.8185302050418503852: The analysis page now also shows GVI and PGS.
data.2143641972973300763: The standard deviation of the values in the target area can now be displayed on the analysis page instead of the number of values.
data.7272790870994895850: Now also the standard deviation of all values of the period will be shown on the analysis page.
data.3688296022209187086: There is an option in the daily graphics there that makes it possible to distinguish the different types of bolus. If this option is set, a bolus that was given for a meal is marked with a different color than the bolus given as correction. In the legend there are also separate values for meal-bolus, correction-bolus and SMB.
data.966584332394053618: Most of Nightscout Reporter is now translated to Spanish and Polish. Corresponding buttons have been added to the main menu. Thanks to the diligent translators :).
data.2234452339074400732: The control for the definition of the period has been adjusted so that it is displayed correctly on narrow display.
data.7061748368653638533: The accuracy of the insulin dosage is determined from the profile. The value with the highest precision defines how many decimalplaces are used for display of basalvalues.
data.153703985810725237: Data from different uploaders is now better interpreted.
data.3644990210412419679: Data which was marked as sync by xDrip will be ignored in the caluclations.
data.6783684155282109561: The colors for dialogs and scrollbars have been adjusted.
data.8834231978593785875: The calculation of actual basal rate was corrected.
data.4719973064533856377: The profile page has been adapted so that entries for 24 hours fit on one page.
data.8613883889694144083: The menu links to Nightscout and the reports of Nightscout now also work correctly when a usertoken was provided.
data.831829680471616146: It is now possible to scroll the main page in Firefox, if it is longer than the browser window.
data.8565611804705215014: Blood values are displayed correctly now in mmol/L in the graphics.
data.4219373503238737879: Standard deviation is now also shown correctly when using mmol/L.
data.2405436612321185531: Wrong alignment of buttons on mainpage has been fixed.
data.7502718767982561417: There is now also the possibility to use Nightscout Reporter in European English. The difference to American English currently exists only in the date format (gb: dd/MM/yyyy, us: MM/dd/yyyy).
data.1684033159361694926: The legend below the daily graph shows the sum of carbohydrates for the day.
data.3704660095733392644: Reservoir changes are now also shown in the daily graph.
data.7115971026305503232: The daily chart now shows the estimated A1C and the percentage of bolus insulin and basal insulin for the day. These values are displayed within the legend, which is why it must be enabled for the values to appear.
data.7081541250790132531: DIA on the profile page is now displayed with two decimal places.
data.6214726337468167755: There is now an option for the daily graphics to toggle the accumulation of close values.
data.6786503488477302998: The carbohydrate information on the daily graph is now output without the suffix KH.
data.2696279668736247520: The bars for the bolus insulin in the daily graph are now scaled according to the maximum bolus insulin at that day.
data.6990358926812955547: In the analysis the percentages for the target areas can be shown with decimal places. This reduces the difference to 100% if you sum it up. The remainder is because of rounding differences.
data.2060321923731505088: The daily graphic now sums up insulin values and carbohydrate values when there are several values within an hour. The bars are still drawn individually for each value. In this way there should be no overlapping output of the values anymore. The summarized values are displayed in square brackets to indicate that values have been summed up here.
data.902981764014355414: Fixed the bug in the profile that caused the ISF and target range values to be incorrectly converted.
data.6816436606199457249: Fixed the erroneous placement of the blood values in the daily graph when using mmol/L.
data.987543708541980470: The profile now uses the correct units (mg/dL or mmol/l).
data.5877491119192060921: New option in the profile to combine consecutive times with the same values into a single entry.
data.6276112877929889283: If more times were recorded in a profile than fit on one page, they were overlaying the content of the next page. Now a new page is created as needed.
data.5435845884171064606: In the daily statistics and in the daily graphics, the days of the week are now displayed with the day of the week.
data.8519038192433264278: Added a new PDF for a weekly graphics where the week's glucose curves are shown all at once.
data.5473044180249684052: New daily graph parameter that determines whether or not to draw the lines for the notes under the graph up to the glucose curve.
data.2678033922423792303: In the analysis, the information for material (catheter, sensor, ampoule) can be displayed with decimal places.
data.3531288787928381694: The calculation of the daily insulin now also takes the SMB into account.
data.4615059425265416391: The daily chart now also displays blood glucose values. They are displayed as red squares and the associated values ​​in the table below the graphic are also displayed in red.
data.7809573780420678903: The microboli of the Minimed 600 Uploader are now also identified and output in the analysis, if they exist.
data.383382329047888868: There is an option in the settings to download the PDF instead of having it displayed directly in the browser. This is needed for browsers like Edge.
data.4314556417043887900: Carbohydrate corrections are now displayed in the daily graph.
data.5078001255280902994: The selection of the period is now more flexible. The selection is done in a dialog that takes the language into account. Selecting the default ranges (today, last week, etc.) sets the current date as the basis for the range at the next call. If the range is set directly in the calendar, then it will be applied the next time as defined. By default, the first day of the week is now a Monday. However, this can be set to your own preference by clicking on the day of the week in the title bar of the month. The date fields are entered in the form that corresponds to the language (day.month.year for German, month/day / year for English).
data.9170455987776194032: The calendar control can no longer select a date after the current day.
data.5353771038969847315: The calendar control now displays the month of the corresponding date when one of the fields From or To receives the focus.
data.126234916911088114: If there are gaps in the entries of 15 minutes or more, there will also be a gap in the daily chart.
data.2655559394819682365: The positioning of the notes in the daily chart has been corrected so that they are closer to the time. The strokes were shortened so that they go only to the bottom of the graph and not through the table of values.
data.7788136692440659939: The own limits on the analysis page in mmol/L are now calculated correctly.
data.3821944844445329552: Fixed a bug that caused the last days of certain months not to be displayed in the calendar control.
data.353974152985344566: An error has probably been fixed that causes some profiles to miss the value for DIA incorrectly.
data.838347286891196953: In the calendar control, a defined period (today, last week, etc.) is now correctly based on the current day.
data.3788895486275509568: Fixed incorrect output of blood glucose levels in the daily graph.
data.7646257712557304842: The profile PDF is now created in landscape format so that profiles with many entries for the parameters can also be displayed.
data.3402565124146215038: If special characters are present in the data (eg smileys in the notes), this caused a crash during the PDF creation. This has been fixed by removing these special characters from the output.

data.6040058982994125338: The daily graphics now displays a chart with half-hourly glucose values. This can be switched off via a parameter.
data.9127179894733336518: In the daily statistics, the column Coefficient of variation has been added (CV).
data.8739263524610748752: SMBs are now also displayed in the daily graphics if the option for displaying insulin has been activated. You can specify whether the SMBs are displayed on the glucose curve or at the target value.
data.5576109405009983748: The calculation of the totals row on the Daily Statistics page has been corrected.
data.4974232145976971100: added additional information about the PDFs and in the UI
data.1875321998396514171: Sums for bolus insulin, basal rate for the day, and basalrate from the profile added to the daily chart
data.8216826430516793510: Some forms can now be configured with parameters; click on the arrow on the right side of the formbutton and make the appropriate settings in the opened area; the arrow will not appear until the form has been marked for printout
data.6718149088815928424: Added number of sensors to analysis
data.4877549963229687416: The possibility for beta functions has been removed; the beta version is now available at:

No profiles could be loaded. It may be that the profile table contains too many entries.
           In this case, it can help if the "Maximum number of profile data records" is reduced in the settings.
data.help-analysis:
This form shows the evaluation of the values ​​of the selected Period. The average consumption of materials is calculated and displayed. This form contains most of the information that diabetologists would like to know.

The A1C is calculated from the available data and normally deviates not insignificantly from the actually measured value. The value that is determined from the blood sample shows the actual binding of glucose in the blood. Since this depends on additional factors and not only on the measurement data used here, there are differences to the calculated value. Especially when the measured values ​​are not blood sugar but tissue sugar, as used by CGM systems.

Nevertheless, this value is a rough guide to the quality of the Glucose setting and in the form determined by the laboratory is often used by diabetologists as a guide value, which is why it is displayed here. But it is issued in a weaker font so that its dubious nature can also be recognized.
data.help-basal:
This form shows the basal rate set in the profile in graphic form. Usually all basal rates for the selected period are displayed. If the basal rate has changed in the period, a new page is created.

However, there is an option that only outputs the last basal rate of the period.
data.help-cgp:
Tento formulář zobrazuje komplexní glykemický pětiúhelník, který reprezentuje kvalitu kontroly glykémie snadno srozumitelným způsobem. Pro zvolené období ukazuje, jak dlouho byla průměrná hodnota glykémie mimo cílový rozsah během dne, jak vysoká byla intenzita hyperglykémie a hypoglykémie, jak vysoká byla průměrná hodnota a jak vysoká byla variabilita hodnot.

Do tohoto grafu lze zahrnout také @05@ a @08@.
data.help-daily-analysis:
Tento formulář zobrazuje přehled na jeden den. Zde
   se zobrazuje denní graf, bazální dávka, úpravy bazálu, aktivní
   inzulin a aktivní sacharidy.
data.help-daygluc:
Tento formulář zobrazuje trend hladin glykémie během dne. Sloupec trendu vždy zobrazuje procento, o které se hodnota změnila z jedné celé hodiny na druhou. Tento trend je velmi užitečný, pokud chcete při testu bazálu zjistit, jak se vyvíjí hodnota glykémie pouze na základě bazálu. Lze také zobrazit sloupec pro hodnoty bolusu a sacharidy. Ty by však samozřejmě měly být při testu bazálu prázdné. Při testu bazálu je také nezbytně nutné vypnout veškeré smyčky. Jde pouze o diabetika a jeho bazální dávky.

Zobrazen je také sloupec s bazální dávkou, pokud není zaškrtnuta volba „Zobrazit všechny hodnoty za den“. Pokud je tato možnost označena, pak zde není místo (a ani smysl) pro její zobrazení.
data.msgBasalInfo: Bazál je platný od {time} a neobsahuje žádné dočasné změny.
data.help-daygraph:
Tento formulář zobrazuje křivku glykémie na jeden den. Pro každý den ve vybraném období se vygeneruje jedna stránka. Existuje mnoho možností, které lze použít k přizpůsobení tohoto formuláře. Volby, které označují smyčku, jsou zobrazeny jinou barvou, aby je bylo možné snadno identifikovat. Možnosti COB a IOB někdy výrazně zpomalují generování formuláře, proto byste je měli používat pouze v případě, že vás o to opravdu zajímá.

Bazál může být zobrazen pod grafikou. Běžící smyčka jej bude neustále zvyšovat a snižovat. Proto můžete zobrazit jak aktuální bazál, tak bazál nastavený v profilu. Pro bazální dávku jsou k dispozici formuláře @09@, @11@ a @02@, pomocí nichž je možné bazály přesněji analyzovat. Můžete mít také vygenerovaný @10@ za den. Ten je poté zobrazen na nové stránce.

Tento formulář Nightscout Reporteru má největší počet stránek. To je důvod, proč je zde možnost zobrazit několik denních grafů na jedné stránce. Samozřejmě, že se tím snižuje přehlednost, ale je velmi užitečné pro přehled o pokroku.
data.5647337924246305060: Draw lines from notes to the curve
data.694386776284983973: Zaokrouhlit hodnoty inzulinu v profilu s maximální přesností
data.help-dayhours: Tento formulář zobrazuje přehled hodin dnů zvoleného období. Zobrazené hodnoty jsou střední hodnoty hodnot naměřených v příslušné hodině. Jsou barevně rozlišeny na základě zvoleného cílového rozsahu. Počáteční hodinu lze nastavit v možnostech formuláře. Sloupec data je vždy vlevo od půlnoci a zobrazuje, kde začíná nový den.
data.help-daylog: Tento formulář zobrazuje data ve formě tabulky. Může se skládat z mnoha stránek v závislosti na zvolených možnostech. Je obzvláště užitečná, chcete-li najít určitá data. Například ji můžete použit k určení toho, kdy byla přepíchnuta kanyla, kolik datových záznamů bylo rozpoznáno jako duplicitních nebo kde byly zaznamenány poznámky.
data.msgLogOverride: doč. přepsat na {$PH} min, Důvod: {$PH_1}, Změna cíle: {$PH_2}, Hodnota: {$PH_3} %
data.help-dayprofile:
Tento formulář zobrazuje aktuální bazální dávku, která běží v průběhu dne, s přihlédnutím k případným dočasným úpravám bazálu. Můžete také zobrazit bazál uložený v profilu. Bazál může být zobrazen jako hodnota, jako procentuální změna ve vztahu k bazálu v profilu, nebo jako obojí. Celkový sloupec zobrazuje bazální dávku vydanou až do odpovídajícího času. Také je možné zobrazit čas se sekundami. Toto lze použít pro matematickou kontrolu zobrazených hodnot.

Pokud je zobrazen bazál z profilu, k určení maximální hodnoty pro zobrazení sloupců se použije maximální hodnota bazálu v profilu. V důsledku toho jsou pruhy rozšířeny nad sloupec pro hodnoty nad 100 % maximální hodnoty bazálu v profilu. Je zde však možnost tyto pruhy oříznout a zobrazit je jako šipky.
data.2031544011794122683: Zobrazit hodnoty nad maximem jako šipky
data.help-daystats: Tento formulář zobrazuje statistické hodnoty pro dny zvoleného období. Pro každý den je vygenerován jeden řádek. Sloupce lze částečně konfigurovat. Je zde také odhadovaná hodnota A1c. Podobně jako @01@ má i tento formulář velmi nízkou informativní hodnotu, a proto se zobrazuje menším fontem.
data.help-glucdist: Tento formulář zobrazuje rozložení hodnot glykémie ve vybraném období.
data.help-percentile:
Tento formulář zobrazuje, jak jsou hodnoty glykémie rozloženy během dne ve vybraném období. Toto rozložení může být zobrazeno graficky i ve formě tabulky.

V grafickém zobrazení jsou oblasti pro určité odchylky označeny barvou. Na řádku je zobrazena střední hodnota. Hodnoty můžete najít v tabulce. Pokud je zobrazen také bazál, pak se jedná o bazální dávku, která byla aktivní na začátku vybraného období.
data.help-profile:
Tento formulář zobrazuje profil. Obvykle jsou zobrazeny všechny profily vybraného období. Pokud se profil během tohoto období změnil, vytvoří se nový list.

Existuje však možnost, která zobrazí pouze poslední profil daného období. Existuje také možnost kombinovat křivky se stejnými hodnotami. Pokud několik po sobě jdoucích časů obsahuje stejné hodnoty, profil se tím zkrátí.
data.help-weekgraph: Tento formulář zobrazuje křivku glykémie v průběhu týdne. Období je rozděleno na týdenní segmenty a každý týden se zobrazí na samostatné stránce. Každý týden má jinou barvu, takže můžete týdny snadno odlišit. Kromě toho lze pro jednotlivé týdny vygenerovat @10@.
